page.title: 14Biography (cont).....
page.content: You could get to Leeds or Castleford for 2d. Some people used a bicycle for these journeys. One elderly gentleman remembers bying bicycle for a weeks wage 4/-, when he was 13 years old in 1910. There were families wiyh a horse and trap and the horses were often ridden. Cars were rare and the same gentleman saw his in 1907 in a shop window at the top of Albiun Street, Leeds. Most people travelled by walking for ecconamys sake. The progress in building has been very rapid since 1919. A lot was built immediatly after the 1st World War. Mr John Green who lived in Kippax Hall responsible for much building of terraced property which stands today,these are in Coronation Avenue and the surrounding area. Even today these are still referred to the "New Building".
